modules.description: This module provides low-level operations for creating, connecting, and managing Netlink sockets, specifically for communication with the kernel using protocols like NETLINK_ROUTE. It works with C-style structures represented via `Ctypes` to interface directly with system calls for socket allocation, connection setup, and teardown. Concrete use cases include implementing custom network configuration tools or monitoring utilities that require direct interaction with routing subsystems via Netlink.

This module manages network interface addresses using Netlink. It provides functions to allocate and iterate over address caches, extract interface indices, labels, and local addresses from Netlink messages. Concrete use cases include retrieving and processing IP address information for network interfaces.

This module manages network link information through operations like retrieving interface statistics, names, and addresses. It works with network link structures and identifiers, enabling direct interaction with system network interfaces. Concrete use cases include querying packet counts, MTU values, and hardware addresses for specific network interfaces.

This module manages in-memory caches of network link objects using Ctypes pointers. It provides operations to iterate over cached entries, convert caches to lists of typed pointers, and free allocated cache memory. Concrete use cases include inspecting or manipulating network interface state from low-level system data.

This module handles low-level Netlink communication with the Linux kernel, offering direct access to network configuration data through Ctypes-based structures. It supports operations for socket management, cache handling, and network link and address manipulation, working with types like `addr`, `Ctypes.ptr`, and `Dl.library`. Concrete use cases include querying interface statistics, managing routing tables, and retrieving IP address information directly from kernel Netlink messages.
